m_DescList: Different operating systems use different newline representations:
Windows: Uses a combination of carriage return and line feed, i.e. <color=#7E3B50>\r\n</color>
Linux/Unix: Uses only line feed, i.e. <color=#7E3B50>\n</color> (\u000A)
Classic Mac: Uses only carriage return, i.e. <color=#7E3B50>\r</color> (\u000D)
However, modern macOS uses the same newline character as Linux/Unix: <color=#7E3B50>\n</color>
Some software can recognize these symbols and display them correctly, while others cannot. Ultimately, this leads to chaotic document presentation!
The following characters are expected to match: <color=#7E3B50>\r \n \t \v </color><color=#AB2800>\u0020 \u00A0</color>
Please construct a regular expression that passes all tests on the right.
